name: Restless Apparition
text:
{W/B}{W/B}{W/B}: Restless Apparition gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: Restless Bones
text:
{3}{B}, {T}: Target creature gains swampwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
{1}{B}: Regenerate Restless Bones.

editions.flavor:
"We mourn our dead. We shroud our dead. We bury our dead. Too often, it seems, we must kill our dead again."
—Grazda, veteran armorer

name: Restless Dead
text: {B}: Regenerate Restless Dead.

editions.flavor:
The rich's heirs often thank them after death . . . but preferably not in person.
—Suq'Ata epigram

name: Restless Dreams
text:
As an additional cost to cast Restless Dreams, discard X cards.
Return X target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Braids dreams of dark rebirth.

name: Restock
text: Return two target cards from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Restock.

editions.flavor: What looked like a retreat was actually a replenishing.

"We hid such stockpiles all over Rath. We should continue that practice here."
—Lin Sivvi

name: Restoration Angel
text:
Flash
Flying
When Restoration Angel enters the battlefield, you may exile target non-Angel creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.

name: Restoration Gearsmith
text: When Restoration Gearsmith enters the battlefield, return target artifact or creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: All she touches turns to well-oiled, delicately calibrated, perfectly balanced gold.

name: Restoration Specialist
text: {W}, Sacrifice Restoration Specialist: Return up to one target artifact card and up to one target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Dwarves' tools are priceless heirlooms handed down through generations.

name: Restore
text: Put target land card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.

editions.flavor:
"See, the land itself raises an altar to the ascendancy of nature."
—Mayael the Anima

name: Restore Balance
text:
Suspend 6—{W} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, pay {W} and exile it with six time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)
Each player chooses a number of lands he or she controls equal to the number of lands controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest. Players sacrifice creatures and discard cards the same way.

name: Restore the Peace
text: Return each creature that dealt damage this turn to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"You can always count on the Azorius to ruin a party."
—Massacre Girl

name: Restrain
text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target attacking creature this turn.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Hanna would give up her own life before she'd abandon the Weatherlight."
—Sisay

name: Resupply
text:
You gain 6 life.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"If the scalelords are the brains of Dromoka's army, the supply caravans are its beating heart."
—Baihir, Dromoka mage

name: Resurrection
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor: "Think of this new life not as a gift from the angels but as a command to fight for their cause once more." —War blessing of Serra

name: Resuscitate
text: Until end of turn, creatures you control gain "{1}: Regenerate this creature."

editions.flavor:
"It is the art of convincing someone to live."
—Orim, Samite healer

name: Retaliate
text: Destroy all creatures that dealt damage to you this turn.

editions.flavor: The Auriok learned perseverance from their forebears. They learned justice from the leonin.

name: Retaliation
text: Creatures you control have "Whenever this creature becomes blocked by a creature, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn."

editions.flavor: A foul, metallic stench clogged Urza's senses. It was then he knew his brother was no more.

name: Retaliator Griffin
text:
Flying
Whenever a source an opponent controls deals damage to you, you may put that many +1/+1 counters on Retaliator Griffin.

editions.flavor: For every eye, an eye. For every tooth, a tooth. Griffins are nothing if not fair.
For every eye, an eye. For every tooth, a tooth. Griffins are nothing if not fair.

name: Retether
text: Return each Aura card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Only creatures can be enchanted this way. (Aura cards that can't enchant a creature on the battlefield remain in your graveyard.)

editions.flavor: The rifts reach into infinite time streams, bringing the divergent products of alternate pasts into the present.

name: Rethink
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}, where X is its converted mana cost.

editions.flavor: "Are you sure you want to do that?"

name: Retraced Image
text: Reveal a card in your hand, then put that card onto the battlefield if it has the same name as a permanent.

editions.flavor: An army from a soldier, a flock from a bird, a school from a fish . . . a profit from an atrocity.

name: Retract
text: Return all artifacts you control to their owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"Secrets are meant to remain secret."
—Memnarch

name: Retraction Helix
text: Until end of turn, target creature gains "{T}: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand."

editions.flavor: Where the geometries of the world collapse, a master of the Æther can harvest power beyond comprehending.

name: Retreat to Coralhelm
text:
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, choose one —
• You may tap or untap target creature.
• Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

name: Retreat to Emeria
text:
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, choose one —
• Create a 1/1 white Kor Ally creature token.
• Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Retreat to Hagra
text:
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, choose one —
• Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains deathtouch until end of turn.
• Each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

name: Retreat to Kazandu
text:
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, choose one —
• Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
• You gain 2 life.

name: Retreat to Valakut
text:
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, choose one —
• Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
• Target creature can't block this turn.

name: Retribution
text: Choose two target creatures an opponent controls. That player chooses and sacrifices one of those creatures. Put a -1/-1 counter on the other.

name: Retribution of the Ancients
text: {B}, Remove X +1/+1 counters from among creatures you control: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Abzan ancestors died to protect their Houses, and they protect them still.

name: Retribution of the Meek
text: Destroy all creatures with power 4 or greater. They can't be regenerated.

editions.flavor:
"Tread upon the meek, and they shall wound your feet and make you crawl."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Retromancer
text: Whenever Retromancer becomes the target of a spell or ability, Retromancer deals 3 damage to that spell or ability's controller.

editions.flavor: "If one harm us, strike them in return. So sayeth the bey."

name: Return
text:
Aftermath (Cast this spell only from your graveyard. Then exile it.)
Exile target card from a graveyard. Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

name: Returned Centaur
text: When Returned Centaur enters the battlefield, target player puts the top four cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: Driven away by his living kin, he wanders mourning through the wilderness, seeking the dead city of Asphodel.
Driven away by his living kin, he wanders mourning through the wilderness, seeking the dead city of Asphodel.

name: Returned Phalanx
text:
Defender
{1}{U}: Returned Phalanx can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender.

editions.flavor: They lived in different nations and fought in different eras, but as the Returned, they link arms as one.

name: Returned Reveler
text: When Returned Reveler dies, each player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: The flesh is dead and the life forgotten, but old habits persist.

name: Return of the Nightstalkers
text: Return all Nightstalker permanent cards from your graveyard to the battlefield. Then destroy all Swamps you control.

name: Return to Battle
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: "Swallowing his eye, the valiant Xiahou Dun fought on; / But Cao Cao's vanguard, its commander wounded, could not hold out for long."

name: Return to Dust
text: Exile target artifact or enchantment. If you cast this spell during your main phase, you may exile up to one other target artifact or enchantment.

editions.flavor: Some timelines forever fray, branch, and intermingle. Others end abruptly.
Some timelines forever fray, branch, and intermingle. Others end abruptly.
Some timelines forever fray, branch, and intermingle. Others end abruptly.

name: Return to the Earth
text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or creature with flying.

editions.flavor:
"Dragons are feared for their breath and their bite, but it is their wings that make them unconquerable. Bring them to earth, and they die like any other beast."
—Kassur, Sultai hunter

name: Return to the Ranks
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Return X target creature cards with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

name: Revealing Wind
text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. You may look at each face-down creature that's attacking or blocking.

editions.flavor:
"The sands obscure the vision of others, but clarify ours."
—Faiso, Dromoka commander

name: Reveillark
text:
Flying
When Reveillark leaves the battlefield, return up to two target creature cards with power 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Evoke {5}{W} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

name: Reveille Squad
text: Whenever one or more creatures attack you, if Reveille Squad is untapped, you may untap all creatures you control.

editions.flavor: "To arms! To arms! The Lion roars!"

name: Reveka, Wizard Savant
text: {T}: Reveka, Wizard Savant deals 2 damage to target creature or player and doesn't untap during your next untap step.

editions.flavor:
"It's nice to see a sister Dwarf in a position of such power, but why'd it have to be one of those seafaring muleheads?"
—Halina, Dwarven Trader

"It's nice to see a sister Dwarf in a position of such power, but why'd it have to be one of those seafaring muleheads?"
—Halina, Dwarven Trader

name: Revelation
text: Players play with their hands revealed.

editions.flavor: "Many are in high place, and of renown: but mysteries are revealed unto the meek." —Ecclesiastes 3:19
"Many are in high place, and of renown: but mysteries are revealed unto the meek." —Ecclesiasticus 3:19

name: Revel of the Fallen God
text: Create four 2/2 red and green Satyr creature tokens with haste.

editions.flavor:
"Xenagos has fallen, and the world grows dark without him. What can ever fill that darkness but our rage?"
—Guruthes, disciple of Xenagos

name: Revelsong Horn
text: {1}, {T}, Tap an untapped creature you control: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: A deflated sigh breathed into the horn emerges as an inspiring melody.

name: Revenant
text:
Flying
Revenant's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"Not again."
—Hans

"Not again."
—Hans
Born from the slaughter of an entire army, it bears the wrath of a hundred souls.
It eats death and drinks pain.

"Not again."
—Hans

name: Revenant Patriarch
text:
When Revenant Patriarch enters the battlefield, if {W} was spent to cast it, target player skips his or her next combat phase.
Revenant Patriarch can't block.

editions.flavor: "The Golgari raise the bodies of their dead to serve. We raise the spirits of our dead to lead."

name: Revenge of the Hunted
text:
Until end of turn, target creature gets +6/+6 and gains trample, and all creatures able to block it this turn do so.
Miracle {G} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)

name: Reverberate
text: Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

editions.flavor:
"I'm not indecisive. I just don't like to limit my options."
—Maxti, pyromancer
For every action, there is a swifter and more violent reaction.

editions.set: Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning
editions.flavor:
"I'm not indecisive. I just don't like to limit my options."
—Maxti, pyromancer
"Not bad, but I can think of a better use for that."

name: Reverberation
text: All damage that would be dealt this turn by target sorcery spell is dealt to that spell's controller instead.

name: Revered Dead
text: {W}: Regenerate Revered Dead.

editions.flavor:
"The mists coalesced into silent warriors. We charged them and broke through their lines, only to see them swirl and re-form behind us."
—Golas Mahr, black knight

name: Revered Elder
text: {1}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Revered Elder this turn.

editions.flavor: The Cho-Arrim worship life and revere those who've experienced it longest.

name: Revered Unicorn
text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
When Revered Unicorn leaves the battlefield, you gain life equal to the number of age counters on it.

editions.flavor:
"I felt unworthy even to dream of it."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

name: Reverence
text: Creatures with power 2 or less can't attack you.

editions.flavor:
"Despite the massive forces that allied against him, Konda never once believed he would lose the Kami War."
—Masako the Humorless

name: Reverent Hunter
text: When Reverent Hunter enters the battlefield, put a number of +1/+1 counters on it equal to your devotion to green. (Each {G} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to green.)

name: Reverent Mantra
text:
You may exile a white card from your hand rather than pay Reverent Mantra's mana cost.
Choose a color. All creatures gain protection from the chosen color until end of turn.

name: Reverent Silence
text:
If you control a Forest, rather than pay Reverent Silence's mana cost, you may have each other player gain 6 life.
Destroy all enchantments.

name: Reversal of Fortune
text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You may copy an instant or sorcery card in it. If you do, you may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.

editions.flavor: "Why learn hundreds of spells when you can learn only one and use it to steal hundreds?"

name: Reverse Damage
text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

editions.flavor:
"My enemy's hatred is his weakness. My enemy's anger is my strength."
—Remin, venerable monk
"Weapons usually bring death. Today, mine will bring life."

name: Reverse Engineer
text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Draw three cards.

editions.flavor: The Hold, an illegal research facility in a derelict merchant ship, became a wellspring of renegade intelligence.

name: Reverse Polarity
text: You gain X life, where X is twice the damage dealt to you so far this turn by artifacts.

name: Reverse the Sands
text: Redistribute any number of players' life totals. (Each of those players gets one life total back.)

editions.flavor: Worse than the years of aging was the burden of memory. The young monk lost his youth and gained a vicarious lifetime of hardship and woe.
Worse than the years of aging was the burden of memory. The young monk lost his youth and gained a vicarious lifetime of hardship and woe.

name: Revive
text: Return target green card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Even what is lost beyond recall returns when coaxed by a dryad's hand.
Even what is lost beyond recall returns when coaxed by a dryad's hand.
Even what is lost beyond recall returns when coaxed by a dryad's hand.
Gerrard's heart ached, recalling the living wreath Mirri laid for her dead kin. No such memorial was left for her in Rath.

name: Revive the Fallen
text: Return target creature card from a graveyard to its owner's hand. Clash with an opponent. If you win, return Revive the Fallen to its owner's hand. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

name: Reviving Dose
text:
You gain 3 life.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Samite healers never mix their pungent elixir with sweetener or tea. The threat of a second dose is enough to get most warriors back on their feet.
As healers battled each plague, they learned more about the next.
Samite healers never mix their pungent elixir with sweetener or tea. The threat of a second dose is enough to get most warriors back on their feet.

name: Reviving Melody
text:
Choose one or both —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: "Listen to my song, and you need never forge a golden mask to return to me."

name: Reviving Vapors
text: Reveal the top three cards of your library and put one of them into your hand. You gain life equal to that card's converted mana cost. Put all other cards revealed this way into your graveyard.

name: Revoke Existence
text: Exile target artifact or enchantment.

editions.flavor:
"There will come a time when the gods will look at mortals and shudder."
—Uremides the philosopher

"No half measures, no regrets. We'll tell no stories of this day. It will be as if it never existed at all."
—Ganedor, loxodon mystic

"No half measures, no regrets. We'll tell no stories of this day. It will be as if it never existed at all."
—Ganedor, loxodon mystic

name: Revoke Privileges
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack, block, or crew Vehicles.

editions.flavor: "By order of Consulate Mandate 482, I am required to detain you, citizen."

name: Revolutionary Rebuff
text: Counter target nonartifact spell unless its controller pays {2}.

editions.flavor: By the time a Consulate sanction becomes official, the renegade quicksmiths have already found a way to circumvent it.

name: Rewards of Diversity
text: Whenever an opponent casts a multicolored spell, you gain 4 life.

editions.flavor:
"Everything is in place. Nothing can happen that isn't part of my plan."
—Urza

name: Reward the Faithful
text: Any number of target players each gain life equal to the highest converted mana cost among permanents you control.

editions.flavor: "When you have drunk your fill, pass the cup to others who thirst."

name: Reweave
text:
Target permanent's controller sacrifices it. If he or she does, that player reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a permanent card that shares a card type with the sacrificed permanent, puts that card onto the battlefield, then shuffles his or her library.
Splice onto Arcane {2}{U}{U} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

name: Rewind
text: Counter target spell. Untap up to four lands.

editions.flavor:
"Time flows like a river. In Tolaria we practice the art of building dams."
—Barrin, master wizard

"Time flows like a river. In Tolaria we practice the art of building dams."
—Barrin, master wizard
"Let's go over this one more time. . . ."
"Let's go over this one more time. . . ."
"The best denials are simply that: a beginning and end unchanged, a dream with no memory."
"The best denials are simply that: a beginning and end unchanged, a dream with no memory."

name: Reya Dawnbringer
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor: "You have not died until I consent."
"You have not died until I consent."
A beacon of hope for a battered army.
"You have not died until I consent."

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic
editions.flavor: "You have not died until I consent."
"You have not died until I consent."

name: Reyhan, Last of the Abzan
text:
Reyhan, Last of the Abzan enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever a creature you control dies or is put into the command zone, if it had one or more +1/+1 counters on it, you may put that many +1/+1 counters on target creature.
Partner (You can have two commanders if both have partner.)

name: Rhet-Crop Spearmaster
text: You may exert Rhet-Crop Spearmaster as it attacks. When you do, it gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. (An exerted creature won't untap during your next untap step.)

editions.flavor: "In the afterlife, I'll have no need of sleep. And until then, I have no time for it!"

name: Rhonas's Monument
text:
Green creature spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Whenever you cast a creature spell, target creature you control gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"The worthy shall hone a strong body to endure the boundless energies of the afterlife."
—Monument inscription

name: Rhonas the Indomitable
text:
Deathtouch, indestructible
Rhonas the Indomitable can't attack or block unless you control another creature with power 4 or greater.
{2}{G}: Another target creature gets +2/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.

name: Rhox
text:
You may have Rhox assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
{2}{G}: Regenerate Rhox. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

editions.flavor: It's as solid as the club in its hand—and about as subtle.

name: Rhox Bodyguard
text:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
When Rhox Bodyguard enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

editions.flavor: An enlightened soul caged in a body made for battle.

"In this new world, I have seen the once-devout rhoxes take up arms with the savages of Jund. I would be offended, but I see the wisdom in their choice."
—Gernan, Dawnray archer

name: Rhox Charger
text:
Trample
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor: "Momentum is a great ally."

name: Rhox Faithmender
text:
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
If you would gain life, you gain twice that much life instead.

editions.flavor: Rhoxes who live long enough to retire from war lend support with their extensive knowledge of combat injuries.

name: Rhox Maulers
text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)
Renown 2 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put two +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes renowned.)

name: Rhox Meditant
text: When Rhox Meditant enters the battlefield, if you control a green permanent, draw a card.

editions.flavor: The weight of her conviction balances on the harmony of her soul.

name: Rhox Pikemaster
text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Other Soldier creatures you control have first strike.

editions.flavor: When the rhoxes charge, everyone else knows which way to run.

name: Rhox War Monk
text: Lifelink

editions.flavor: Rhox monks are dedicated to spiritual growth and learning, and most bear the sigils of many students. However, they do not gladly suffer fools or those who disagree with their carefully wrought dogma.

Rhox monks are dedicated to spiritual growth and learning, and most bear the sigils of many students. However, they do not gladly suffer fools or those who disagree with their carefully wrought dogma.

Rhox monks are dedicated to spiritual growth and learning, and most bear the sigils of many students. However, they do not gladly suffer fools or those who disagree with their carefully wrought dogma.

name: Rhys the Exiled
text:
Whenever Rhys the Exiled attacks, you gain 1 life for each Elf you control.
{B}, Sacrifice an Elf: Regenerate Rhys the Exiled.

editions.flavor: Once a famed hunter and packmaster, now a renegade seeking his own path.

name: Rhys the Redeemed
text:
{2}{G/W}, {T}: Create a 1/1 green and white Elf Warrior creature token.
{4}{G/W}{G/W}, {T}: For each creature token you control, create a token that's a copy of that creature.

editions.flavor: Whole again in honor and horn.

name: Rhystic Cave
text: {T}: Choose a color. Add one mana of that color to your mana pool unless any player pays {1}. Activate this ability only any time you could cast an instant.

editions.flavor:
"All mages dip into the same well; some are just in more of a hurry."
—Alexi, zephyr mage

name: Rhystic Circle
text: {1}: Any player may pay {1}. If no one does, the next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

editions.flavor: The circle buys time—an important commodity in battle.

name: Rhystic Deluge
text: {U}: Tap target creature unless its controller pays {1}.

editions.flavor:
"I'll rain down on you with the power of magic itself. Then we'll see who prevails."
—Alexi, zephyr mage

name: Rhystic Lightning
text: Rhystic Lightning deals 4 damage to target creature or player unless that creature's controller or that player pays {2}. If he or she does, Rhystic Lightning deals 2 damage to the creature or player.

name: Rhystic Scrying
text: Draw three cards. Then, if any player pays {2}, discard three cards.

editions.flavor:
"The trick is to ask when no one's listening."
—Alexi, zephyr mage

name: Rhystic Shield
text: Creatures you control get +0/+1 until end of turn. They get an additional +0/+2 until end of turn unless any player pays {2}.

editions.flavor: A shield for one is good. A shield for everyone is even better.

name: Rhystic Study
text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, you may draw a card unless that player pays {1}.

editions.flavor: Friends teach what you want to know. Enemies teach what you need to know.
Friends teach what you want to know. Enemies teach what you need to know.
